title: How to Make Green Spaghetti With Basil Pesto

steps.headline: Blend the basil pesto using a blender.
steps.description: Add: 1/2 cup of olive oil, 1/2 cup of water, 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese, and 2 cups of fresh basil leaves. Blend until mixed into a smooth puree.

steps.headline: Boil water.
steps.description: Fill a large pot with 5-10 cups of water, and add about a teaspoon of oil into water by eye, so the spaghetti won't stick to the pot.

steps.headline: Add spaghetti into pot.
steps.description: After water comes to a boil, insert spaghetti and cook for about 7-15 minutes. Stir spaghetti every 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Strain spaghetti.
steps.description: Pour spaghetti into strainer to strain water. After you strain the spaghetti pour it back into the pot.

steps.headline: Add basil pesto.
steps.description: Use pasta spoon to mix the spaghetti and pesto. Now ready to serve.

text: Blend the basil pesto using a blender. Add: 1/2 cup of olive oil, 1/2 cup of water, 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese, and 2 cups of fresh basil leaves. Blend until mixed into a smooth puree. Boil water. Fill a large pot with 5-10 cups of water, and add about a teaspoon of oil into water by eye, so the spaghetti won't stick to the pot. Add spaghetti into pot. After water comes to a boil, insert spaghetti and cook for about 7-15 minutes. Stir spaghetti every 2-3 minutes. Strain spaghetti. Pour spaghetti into strainer to strain water. After you strain the spaghetti pour it back into the pot. Add basil pesto. Use pasta spoon to mix the spaghetti and pesto. Now ready to serve.
